*The Big Finish Announcement* üì£ It's been 12 weeks since Meals for the NHS began, and we‚Äôre now preparing to wrap up our mission with all meals delivered to frontline NHS staff dealing with COVID-19 by 30th June 2020. We wanted to share our journey with you and ask you to donate one last time!  It began back in March, and with the help of: üôã over 100 volunteers üçî 222 food providers (who were also in desperate need of a lifeline) üéâ and a whopping ¬£1,736,696 in donations ...we have: üè• fed 118 hospitals  üòã delivered 233,928 meals!  We‚Äôre SO proud to have achieved this, but recently we‚Äôve been really happy to see many of the hospitals we‚Äôre working with reduce their orders for meals as COVID-19 cases begin to subside.  While we acknowledge there may well be a ‚Äòsecond wave‚Äô coming, we can‚Äôt predict when. So while we have the money to buy meals and the volunteers to make it happen, we want to make this time count.  That‚Äôs why we‚Äôve come to the decision to work towards The Big Finish for Meals for the NHS, with a target of delivering a final total of 285,000 meals to our amazing NHS frontline.  Donations will close on 16th June 2020, so if you'd like to give us a final helping hand, you have until then to donate üíô #FeedTheFrontline #MealsForTheNHS #ThankYouNHS

"Thank you so so much for all the deliveries it has honestly been incredible and helped so many of the NHS staff during the pandemic. You guys should all the so proud of the brilliant company you founded! Thanks again üôå" . We got this lovely message from one of the staff members at Whipps Cross Hospital last night! It was the eve of their last meal delivery, and we're just over the moon to hear the difference the meals have been making. . We've been delivering to Whipps Cross since the beginning back in March, 75 deliveries all in all, including this one snapped here in April üòä‚†Ä . #FeedTheFrontlines #MealsForTheNHS

Following the wonderful news that we've now helped over 200 food providers across the country, meet the lovely @veganjunkiesuk who have been feeding the frontline around Manchester üåà "We are Vegan Junkies aka Sophie and Dave. We‚Äôre a street food business and 2020 was set to be off the charts fantastic - we were booked up with festivals from May to October - and this was only our second season ever after starting Vegan Junkies as a New Years Resolution back in January 2019 - we were so excited! ü•≥ But one massive coronavirus spanner in the works later and our entire 2020 income disappeared! üò≥ But an NCASS job alert was to save the day - we signed up with Meals for the NHS and it‚Äôs been 100% of our income since early April and fingers crossed it can carry on as long as possible!  And we LOVE cooking for NHS staff - we are in awe of the work they do and take great pride in the wonderful feedback we receive about our food üôèüèº The NHS orders have also allowed us to commit to a weekly cook for a local homeless charity which is helping people much worse off than us during this testing time.  So massive love to NHS staff everywhere and a HUGE hug for Meals for the NHS." üíô #FeedTheFrontline #MealsForTheNHS #ThankYouNHS

200 GLORIOUS FOOD PROVIDERS üéâüéâüéâ
 Meals for the NHS started out just over two months ago, with a mission of helping a few frontline staff who were suddenly faced with terrifyingly long hours, late nights and no means of feeding themselves a decent meal after hours.  As well as the pandemic being a horrendous ordeal for the NHS, it rapidly became an issue for the hospitality industry. Customers disappeared overnight, leaving many small businesses fearing the worst.  Today, your donations have helped keep 212 local restaurants all over the UK going, allowing them to bring back staff, regain confidence and do something truly amazing for the NHS.  We can't say thank you enough to our phenomenal food providers, for sharing their delicious cuisines and giving the frontline something to look forward to every evening üíô Doodle creds to @muirwooddraws üòé  #FeedTheFrontline #MealsForTheNHS #ThankYouNHS

We believe that change can happen when people come together in solidarity, behind a single cause, no matter how small or big their effort. That is the driving principle behind Meals for the NHS. That‚Äôs why we want to come together in solidarity with the Black Lives Matter movement. We stand with our Black volunteers, food providers, NHS staff and donors.  The many appalling events that have happened in the US, UK and elsewhere, cannot be ignored. Put simply: racial injustice must not be tolerated. Period. During our remaining time of supporting the NHS and food providers through the crisis, we are creating a forum for discussions with our volunteers to educate ourselves more.

With restaurant doors likely to remain closed until July, at the very least, your donations are supporting local businesses across the country, providing the help they need to stay open. As we continue to showcase the phenomenal food providers helping us fuel the frontline, meet @215hackney, who have been spreading joy across London hospitals with their tasty treats üíô ‚ÄúFor us at 215 Hackney the definition of Meals for the NHS would be ‚Äòa bunch of good samaritans‚Äô. Their initiative to provide nutritious meals for our frontline health workers was no brainer so we quickly decided to jump on board to be part of the movement for humanity. In just over a month of deliveries to our frontline NHS we produced over 5,000 meals and dropped them off to 11 different hospitals across London and of course this wouldn‚Äôt have been possible without the support and encouragement we got from Meals for the NHS. A special thanks to everyone at Meals for the NHS for making this possible, to financially support small independent businesses in daunting circumstances (such a relief), keeping our sanity in check when things weren‚Äôt looking good and simply giving us a lifeline and a reason to smile, we salute you! And for every NHS frontline hero reading this, from doctors to the nurses, the porters to the paramedics, you are the real life heroes! Putting your own life at risk to save ours means the world. Utmost respect for your bravery and courageous spirit, thank you!‚Äù  #SupportSmallBusiness #FeedTheFrontlines #MealsForTheNHS

As the UK starts to experience the small steps of lockdown measures easing, small restaurant owners continue to feel the strain, with millions of jobs in the hospitality industry at risk.  Whilst fuelling the frontline, your donations are also going towards small businesses desperately struggling to stay afloat.  Meet @pabellonvenezuelanfood who have been delighting our NHS superstars with their delicious meals in hospitals across the capital.  ‚ÄúMeals for the NHS saved my business. We wouldn't have been able to survive without them. When we were hit by Covid19, we had also signed up to Deliveroo, Uber Eats and Just Eat, but we have been struggling to pick up orders from any of those platforms. With all the street food markets closed, we faced a critical moment, and then thankfully, Meals for the NHS got in touch.  Today, Meals for the NHS pays both mine and my wife's wages - this not only helps us cover our expenses, but it also helps us give economical support to my parents, who are part of the at risk group. Meals for the NHS currently represent more than 90% of our business income.‚Äù  #SupportSmallBusiness #FeedTheFrontlines #MealsfortheNHS

For our next peek into our incredible people behind the meals, meet @fullofchaat, a Birmingham based restaurant who have been feeding many of their local hospitals including Walsall Manor Hospital and Good Hope Hospital.  With the hospitality industry facing an uncertain future, your donations are helping hundreds of small businesses who are currently struggling financially, to regain some confidence and play a valuable role in this pandemic.  ‚ÄúWhen the government announced the shutdown of all events and festivals, we lost all viable income for one of the busiest Summers we had planned to date, with a young family and a wedding to pay for we were completely lost at how we could drastically change our business model to stay afloat.  ‚ÄùThankfully NCASS sent us some information about a charity called ‚ÄòMeals for the NHS‚Äô, we had never heard of them but after looking into what they were providing we were amazed that we could not only contribute to the key workers and their families but also potentially keep our small independent going!  ‚ÄúJust wow, we have now been providing meals for 6 different West Midlands trusts, we have made and distributed over 2000 meals through this amazing charity and because of this has meant we have not had to furlough all of our staff.  ‚ÄúThe work we are doing has boosted morale and allows us to help others in the only way we know how, feeding them! The nurses and doctors we meet when dropping off the food are always looking forward to us arriving, they always have smiles on their faces and the thanks we get is sometimes overwhelming.  ‚ÄúThis is all down to ‚ÄòMeals for the NHS‚Äô and the donors that support them. Thank you so much from all of us, it‚Äôs not just the NHS hero‚Äôs you are keeping going through these difficult times. We might even be able to fund our wedding after this summer after all!‚Äù  #SupportSmallBusiness #FeedTheFrontlines #MealsForTheNHS

Today, we want to introduce you to some of the amazing people behind the meals, and share their stories of the challenges they‚Äôve faced and experiences of feeding their local frontline.  Because not only do your donations do amazing things for our NHS frontline staff, they‚Äôre also helping small businesses across the country regain confidence and hope by offering a financial lifeline during this pandemic.  Meet Ian and Aymon from @corporatecatuk: ‚ÄúMeals for The NHS make up 100 percent of our business at present. Apart from the ability to furlough some of our staff, we did not qualify for government assistance when COVID-19 happened.  ‚ÄúLike many independent small businesses,  we lost all our orders overnight, and we prepared for the worst. Meals for The NHS offered us a lifeline, a way to keep our company afloat during a difficult period.  ‚ÄúWe feel very honoured to be providing food for the NHS staff as they battle COVID-19, thanks to Meals for the NHS we have a value, we can play a vital role during the pandemic.  ‚ÄúWe will be forever grateful to Meals for The NHS; It is impossible to put into words what this group of people have achieved by bringing together struggling businesses to provide food for our hardworking NHS staff in hospitals all over the country.‚Äù #SupportSmallBusiness #FeedTheFrontlines #MealsForTheNHS

Happy International Nurses Day!

To celebrate, we wanted to share some of the incredible nurses who have been able to enjoy delicious meals over the last few weeks, thanks to your donations. 
Of course, right now, every day should be nurses day. But this year it‚Äôs particularly special as today is also Florence Nightingale‚Äôs 200th birthday. Celebrated as the ‚Äòfounder of modern nursing‚Äô, she is legendary for a lot of reasons including improving hospital conditions and sparking worldwide healthcare reforms. 
Her determination to help her fellow nurses and improve their lives is inspiring us to do more to support today‚Äôs nurses. Nurses who up and down the country are risking their health to keep us safe and well. 
Which is why we‚Äôre aiming high on her 200th birthday, setting a goal of raising ¬£2m to help us deliver meals in 200 hospitals. Help us get there by donating a meal today üíô‚Ä™#InternationalNursesDay #IND2020 #ThankYouNurses

It takes a small village to get Meals to the NHS!  We‚Äôre elated to announce that today, Solihull Hospital will be receiving their last delivery from us as they‚Äôre becoming a 'covid-free' hospital üéâ @uhbtrust  It‚Äôs important to celebrate the little wins - and this is definitely one of them! So here's a little message of support from some of the volunteers who have helped get food to the frontline.  A whopping 1,500 meals have been delivered to Solihull Hospital over the past month thanks to a tremendous effort from our lovely local food providers: Full of Chaat, Gorilla Coffee Cafe, Hookways, Jamaya, Mi Banh Mi, Sapore Restaurant, Sticky Beaks, The Middle Feast & What the Cluck - thank you so much to the restaurant teams for working tirelessly to feed the frontline at Solihull, their final delivery is from @gorillacoffeeuk üíô We‚Äôre still very busy signing up new hospitals dealing with COVID-19 all over the UK - if your ward needs an extra boost, don‚Äôt hesitate to register on our website! #MealsForTheNHS #FeedTheFrontlines #ThankYouNHS‚†Ä

"I thought by registering with Meals for the NHS perhaps we would get meals delivered for a day. As a lovely treat for staff. What we have actually ended up with is over 2,000 meals, delivered to our door and given directly to our frontline staff.  . "The day I registered our hospital on your website our staff canteen had just had to close. I was so worried about the effect that this would have - an army marches on its stomach and staff would no longer be able to buy themselves food to get them through their busy shift. . "It has been a daily morale boost for our hard working nurses, carers, therapists, doctors, domestics, porters, security guards and support staff to know that people have taken the time to donate money to show they are grateful for all they are doing.  . "I can easily say that the feeling of joy when delivering the food to the wards will be something that I will remember forever! We have loved the little notes that arrive with our food, the messages of thanks and the meeting people from small local businesses that I am sure we will keep in touch with after all this is over.  . "I will sum up with a cheesy quote... "Food is symbolic of love when words are inadequate". Thanks so much for the love Meals for the NHS!" . - Katie, the Head of Services, over at The Royal Hospital for Neuro-disability reminding us the phenomenal difference a meal (or 2,000!) can make.  As we've said from the beginning, you can't save the nation on an empty stomach, so we'll keep feeding those facing the frontline üíô  . #ThankYouNHS #FeedTheFrontlines #MealsfortheNHS
